alert.note: Alert for Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 12:27PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A GLACIER-DAMMED LAKE OUTBURST IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 AM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a glacier-dammed lake outburst is expected. * WHERE...The following area, Mendenhall Lakes Area. * WHEN...Until 1145 AM AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise of their banks and flow across roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1203 PM AKDT, USGS web camera images of Suicide Basin indicate that the basin is releasing. - - For Mendenhall Lake : At 11:15am the stage was 6.44 feet. Flood Stage is 9.0 feet. Forecast: A crest around 9.0 feet is expected around 10:00am Friday. - At 7.7 feet Nugget Falls Trail begins to flood near the beginning of the trail. - At 9.1 feet Water covers Skaters Cabin road between Skaters Cabin and West Glacier trailhead, and water will begin to flow into the Mendenhall Lake Campground. - Inherent uncertainty in initial glacier lake volume will result in varying crest height and timing.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.

area.areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island
